task.summary: Default task
Added function to backup shell config file before adding direnv extensions
Ddirenv() now handles all direnv tasks, renamed module to make_env.py

Simplified setup_paths(), handled FileNotFound exception in install_direnv()
- setup_paths() returns direnv_bin (str) not abs_paths (dict)
Renamed 'shell_info' to 'shell', added messages to direnv_handler()
Completed uninstall_direnv() v1

Refactor: Replaced (redundant, complex) resolve_path() with std lib functions
- Refactor: removed unused parameter 'root_name' from setup_paths(). - Refactor: removed unused paramter 'direnv_bin' from uninstall_direnv()
Reformat: File was reformatted on suggestion of PyCharm inspector

Backup includes current PATH, direnv paths changed
- A copy of direnv binary is made at ~/bin/direnv/ - Backups now made at ~/bin/direnv/backups - backup_shell_config() now also backs up current PATH. - install_direnv() refactored into copy_direnv(), make_exec(), install_direnv(). - FileNotFound exceptions abort installation after 3 attempts. - setup_paths() returns direnv_paths (dict).
backup_shell_config() returns error codes & optional error messages on failure

Refactored direnv_bin_path (str) to direnv_paths (dict) with more info
- Improved direnv_handler() instaled/not-installed msg.

Added test for paths_setup()
- test_make_env.py added to make_env/tests/ - Test for make_env.setup_paths()

Refactored backup fn, backup error code returns as namedtuple
- backup_shell_config() refactored into backup_shell_config() & backup_path_var() wrapped in backup() - Modified individual backup functions to return error codes using namedtuples. - Added optional param to backup functions to display user-friendly error messages. - Added identify_shell(<params>) to force use of a specific shell during unittesting. - Added finally: block for identiyf_shell() exception handling instead of if: . -

Replaced shell_hooks (dict) with shell_hooks (named tuple, self-documenting)
- replaced the field 'insert' with 'command' in shell_info, shell_hooks
Added test for identify_shell()

Converted make_env shell handling functions into Class SubShell in subshell_class module
- Convenient sharing of common data via self .. Gives organization. .. Unpythonic, annoying to do module.class.function() .. Class & instance methods have overheads that functions don't
- Considering converting into static methods .. Gives organization benefit without overhead .. Might do it as a learning exercise
- Considering converting make_env Shell handling functions into flat functions .. Gives organizaton benefit .. No class overheads .. easy to type module.function() .. Good idea it would seem.

Created module toolkit for some custom helpful functions
- debug_print() print function to help with debugging - clean_tree() uses removes a tree, changes permissions if necessary

Created tests for subshell_class.py
- tests subshell_class.identify_shell() - tests subshell_class.make_dirs()
Renamed <project_root>/core/ to <project_root>/src/
Archived test_toolkit.py to <project_root>/archived_code (overcomplicated)
Renamed subshell_class.py, test_SubShell_Class to subshell_instance.py, test_subshell_instance.py
Added __init__ to SubShell and some exception handling to the methods

Added: test_copy_binary, exception handling. Refactored: MyTestCase => 3 classes
- MyTestCase class was refactored into 3 classes to ascertain if that \ would add predictability to order of testing. (It didn't) - Removed teardown() as it added to more confusion than help - Changed some utilities to enable optional params for debug messages \ & error handling

Added change_permissions(), fn_init(), fn_outcome() improved cleanup_tree()
- change_permissions() function - Somewhat improved and more reliable cleanup_tree() - Optional parameters to enable error-handling & messages - fn_init(), fn_outcome() to indicate function calls & outcomes
Added log file in /logs/ to gather console output from test_copy_dir()

New unit tests for subshell.py without the unittests framework
- It was adding to the confusion

Amended: Added toolkit.py, mistakenly left out in the original commit
- Original Commit msg: Added change_permissions(), fn_init(), fn_outcome(), improved cleanup_tree()
- change_permissions() function - Somewhat improved and more reliable cleanup_tree() - Optional parameters to enable error-handling & messages - fn_init(), fn_outcome() to indicate function calls & outcomes

Amended: Added toolkit.py, mistakenly left out in the original commit
- Minor changes to make_env.py - Original Commit msg: Added change_permissions(), fn_init(), fn_outcome(), improved cleanup_tree()
- change_permissions() function - Somewhat improved and more reliable cleanup_tree() - Optional parameters to enable error-handling & messages - fn_init(), fn_outcome() to indicate function calls & outcomes

Added tests for subshell.SubShell methods, unittest framework scrapped
- Imported and used toolkit.py functions - setup_tests() - test_setup_tests() - test_make_dirs() - test_copy_binary() - test_make_exec()

Refactored methods from src/subshell.py into subshell_refactored.py
- Moved methods not planned for cls SubShell into subshell_refactored.py - Removed extraneous comented out test from tests/test_subshell_2.py
Refactored backup related functions from make_env.py to its own module backup.py
Added __init__.py in /archived_code to import functions if needed
Added __init__.py in /archived_code to import functions if needed
Refactored unused functions from./src/make_env/py into ./archived_code
Substituted absent key exception handling with default value arg in get() method

Added /logs/Error - backup.txt to save exceptions from backup.py
- Initiated the outlines of a toolkit.excep_handle_frontend() for \ user facing reusable error handling function in
Created backups of bashrc and $PATH in /backups/

Removed error handling for better error clarity
- made backup() as interface wrapper
Added /src/main.py to call & run functions for installation

Handled PermissionsError in backups module
- removed default permission arg from toolkit.change_permissions() - in main, make_dir() is now called before backups.backups()
Added empty definitions for restore functions to backup.py

Added toolkit.reattempt(), added file args handling in toolkit.check_remove()
- Improved exception handling in toolkit.get_file_permissions_via_shell()
Created a /src/error_handling.py for exception handling

Simplified /src/subshell.copy_binary() error handling
- Abortive attempt to create /src/error_handling_2.py - Added SubShell.paths.copiedfile to copy & rename direnv binary in-place \ then move

Added, modified and removed functions from /src/subshell.py
- copy_move_binary() combines both copy & move functions. - removed copy_binary() & move_bonary(). - Added change_paths() to incorporate user-specified path changes.
Added docstrings to /src/toolkit.py, /src/subshell.py
Expanded profile config files list & modified (subshell, backup).py accordingly
Fixed: shell['files'] in /src/make_env.identify_shell() is empty

Added 'force' parameter to identify shell call in /src/subshell.SubShell
- Modified force parameter in make_env.identify_shell(force) \ to True/False from 'force', 'no' - Done to allow forcing a shell in NT for shell config files paths.
Added multiple shell config files to shell['files']
